SEARCH

All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
Board
Describes the board on which the tiles are placed.
Bookshelf
This class represents the bookshelf of a player.
Client
This class represents a client that can connect to the server via RMI or Socket.
ClientApp
 
ClientRMIInterface
Interface implemented by a client to receive updates from the server using Remote Method Invocation.
Color
Colors used in the CLI
Command
Interface used to implement a command pattern.
CommandMessage
This abstract class is impemented by all the messages sent by the Client to the Server.
CommandMessageWrapper
This class wraps the message sent by the client or the server.
CommonGoalCard
CommonGoalCard abstract class that allows to implement a strategy pattern.
CommonGoalDeck
Deck containing all the CommonGoalCards.
Configuration
This class is used to read the JSON configuration file, that will be bundled in the JAR.
ConnectingStatuses
Enumeration of possible connecting statuses.
CreateGameCommand
This class implements a command (following the command design pattern) that creates a new game.
CreateGameMessage
This kind of command message is used to create a game.
CrossTiles
Common Goal Card: five tiles of the same type forming an X.
DiagonalTiles
Common Goal Card: five tiles of the same type forming a diagonal.
EndGameControllerFX
This class is the controller for the view of the end game screen.
EqualCorners
Common Goal Card: four tiles of the same type in the four corners of the bookshelf.
EqualEight
Common Goal Card: eight tiles of the same type.
EventManager
This class is used to manage the Listener and the events.
EventWrapper
This class wraps a message to be sent to the clients, including the updated GameView and the event that triggered the update.
Game
Class representing a Game.
GameController
This class is the controller of a game.
GameController.GameDefinition
Inner class used to represent a game.
GameControllerFX
Controller for the GameFXML scene, i.e.
GameControllerSaver
This class provides functionality to save and load gameControllers to/from a file.
GameEvent
Enumeration of all the possible evevnts that can be generated inside the model and sent to the clients.
GameListener
Listener responsible for events that are triggered by a change occurring in the model.
GameView
This class is the immutable version of the Game class, which allows the distributed MVC paradigm to work.
HeartBeatMessage
This is a speccial kind of CommandMessage since it is not linked to any Command class.
ImmutableBoard
Immutable version of the Board, used to send the board to the clients.
ImmutableBookshelf
Immutable version of Bookshelf, used to send the bookshelf to the clients.
ImmutablePlayer
Immutable version of Player to be sent to the client.
InvalidCommandException
This exception is thrown when the command is not valid, for example when the game is not in the right state.
ItemType
Enumerates the types of tiles.
JoinGameCommand
This class implements a command (following the command design pattern) that adds a player to a game.
JoinGameMessage
With this message a Client communicates the will to join the game gameName
Listener<T extends Enum<T>>
Generic Listener interface.
LobbiesControllerFX
Controller responsible for the Lobby screen
LobbyController
This class is the entry point of every command received by the server.
LobbyControllerFX
This class is the controller for the view of a single lobby inside the list of available games shown in the lobby view.
LocatedTile
This class extends Tile adding the information about the location of the tile in the board.
LoggingFormatter
Formatter for the server logger
LoggingFormatterWithColor
Custom formatter for the server logger.
LoginControllerFX
This class is the controller for the view of the login screen.
ModelState
Enumerates the possible states of a Game.
NicknameMessage
This message is sent by the Client to the server when the client wants to join a game or rejoin after disconnection.
OtherPlayerItemController
This class controls the view of other players' public items, which are their bookshelf, their nickname, their hand and their tokens.
Pair<L,R>
A simple generic class to hold a pair of objects
PersonalGoalCard
Class that represents a personal goal card.
PersonalGoalDeck
Class that represents the deck of personal goal cards.
PickedTilesCommandMessage
This class represents the command used to send the choice of the tiles picked from the Board.
PickTilesCommand
This class implements a command (following the command design pattern) that picks tiles from the board.
Player
Class that represents a player in the game.
PrinterCLI
This is an utility class used to facilitate printing on the command line interface.
RankingControllerFX
This class is the controller for the view of the ranking component in the leaderboard in the end game screen.
RefreshAvailableGamesMessage
This message is used to request the list of available games from the server, since this list is not sent automatically except from the first time the client connects to the server.
SameTypeGroupings
Common Goal Card: two types of cards are of this type.
ScoringToken
Class that represents a scoring token.
SelectColumnCommand
This class implements a command (following the command design pattern) that selects a column in the bookshelf.
SelectedColumnMessage
This class represents the command used to send the choice of the column of the bookshelf in which the user wants to put their tile(s)
SelectedTileFromHandCommandMessage
This class represents the command sent to the server to choose which tile the player wants to put in the selected column (amongst the ones present in their hand)
SelectTileFromHandCommand
This class implements a command (following the command design pattern) that selects a tile from the hand.
Server
Server class.
ServerEventManager
Customer EventManager for the server.
ServerRMIInterface
The RMI interface implemented by the server that is used by the client to communicate with the server using remote method invocation.
SlightlyDifferentLines
Common Goal Card: four cards are of this type.
SquareTiles
Common Goal Card: two groups each containing 4 tiles of the same type in a 2x2 square.
StairTiles
Common Goal Card: five columns of increasing or decreasing height.
Tile
Class representing a Tile.
TileBag
Class representing the bag containing all the tiles.
UserInputEvent
List of all the types of messages that can be sent from the client to the server.
UserInputListener
Listener responsible for events that are triggered by user input.
View
This is the view interface (intended as in the MVC pattern) that is implemented by the GUI and CLI.
ViewCLI
This class is the command-line interface of the game.
ViewGUI
This class is the graphical interface of the client.
WrongArgumentException
 
WrongTurnException
This exception is thrown when the player tries to perform an action when it's not their turn.
